Face recognition
==================

Images are in the biggest market in business environment. Companies as TikTok and Instagram are becoming more and more important because they use images rather than words. In my work, I studied some of these applications, such as Google Cloud Platform and Microsoft Azure. 
My focus is not only about image recognition, but it’s focused about emotion recognition. For this reason, I start to analyze their services which sells as Artificial Intelligence as a Service (AIaaS). 
In fact, Google and Microsoft are really committed about these projects. As you know, facial recognition is a branch of machine learning. Machine learning is of the most important area in computer science. In the last few years, all the biggest ICT companies are developing and studying this new path of science. 


## Some links for more in depth learning
### Books

### Sites

Code
------------
## Language and flow/state/sequence diagrams
The project is based on Node. The language is [Typescript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/). Conceptually the project is divided in three areas.

[![](https://mermaid.ink/img/eyJjb2RlIjoiZ3JhcGggVERcblx0QVtHZXQgYW5kIHNldCBsb2NhbCBlbnZpcm9ubWVudF0gLS0-QltTdGFydCBhbmFseXNpc11cblx0QiAtLT5DW2NyZWF0ZXMuY3N2XVx0IiwibWVybWFpZCI6eyJ0aGVtZSI6ImRlZmF1bHQifSwidXBkYXRlRWRpdG9yIjpmYWxzZX0)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#/edit/eyJjb2RlIjoiZ3JhcGggVERcblx0QVtHZXQgYW5kIHNldCBsb2NhbCBlbnZpcm9ubWVudF0gLS0-QltTdGFydCBhbmFseXNpc11cblx0QiAtLT5DW2NyZWF0ZXMuY3N2XVx0IiwibWVybWFpZCI6eyJ0aGVtZSI6ImRlZmF1bHQifSwidXBkYXRlRWRpdG9yIjpmYWxzZX0)

For a better distribution, it’s possible to create an executable for running on different operations system as Windows, Apple and Linux.
I also created a state diagram to explain the flow.
[![](https://mermaid.ink/img/eyJjb2RlIjoic3RhdGVEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgc3RhdGUgZm9ya19zdGF0ZSA8PGZvcms--IGZvcmtfc3RhdGVcbiAgICAgIGZvcmtfc3RhdGUgLS0-IEdvb2dsZVxuICAgICAgc3RhdGUgR29vZ2xlIHtcbiAgICAgICAgICAgIFsqXSAtLT4gR2V0TGlzdEltYWdlc1xuICAgICAgICAgICAgR2V0TGlzdEltYWdlcyAtLT4gQW5hbHl6ZUltYWdlXG4gICAgICAgICAgICBBbmFseXplSW1hZ2UgLS0-IENvbnZlcnRTdHJpbmdUb051bWJlclxuICAgICAgfVxuICAgICAgR29vZ2xlIC0tPiBDb252ZXJ0SlNPTnRvQ1NWXG4gICAgICBDb252ZXJ0SlNPTnRvQ1NWIC0tPiBbKl0iLCJtZXJtYWlkIjp7InRoZW1lIjoiZGVmYXVsdCJ9LCJ1cGRhdGVFZGl0b3IiOmZhbHNlfQ)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#/edit/eyJjb2RlIjoic3RhdGVEaWFncmFtXG4gICAgc3RhdGUgZm9ya19zdGF0ZSA8PGZvcms--IGZvcmtfc3RhdGVcbiAgICAgIGZvcmtfc3RhdGUgLS0-IEdvb2dsZVxuICAgICAgc3RhdGUgR29vZ2xlIHtcbiAgICAgICAgICAgIFsqXSAtLT4gR2V0TGlzdEltYWdlc1xuICAgICAgICAgICAgR2V0TGlzdEltYWdlcyAtLT4gQW5hbHl6ZUltYWdlXG4gICAgICAgICAgICBBbmFseXplSW1hZ2UgLS0-IENvbnZlcnRTdHJpbmdUb051bWJlclxuICAgICAgfVxuICAgICAgR29vZ2xlIC0tPiBDb252ZXJ0SlNPTnRvQ1NWXG4gICAgICBDb252ZXJ0SlNPTnRvQ1NWIC0tPiBbKl0iLCJtZXJtYWlkIjp7InRoZW1lIjoiZGVmYXVsdCJ9LCJ1cGRhdGVFZGl0b3IiOmZhbHNlfQ)

The main file is **main.ts** which it’s the core of this project. As a result, main.ts rules *AzureStorageProcess, AzureImageAnalyzer* and *GoogleImageAnalyzer*. These three classes have different aims.
AzureStorageProcess contains the services to recover each URL’s images while AzureImageAnalyzer and GoogleImageAnalyzer contains the services to analyze images, for each provider respectively.

[![](https://mermaid.)](https://mermaid-js.github.io/mermaid-live-editor/#)

Another schema that it helps to understand the flow of Azure and Google, it’s the sequence diagram.
The first schema is about Google.

## Set local environment
At the root project you have to create a .local folder and inside you have to move two files: google credentials and setting.json
Azure uses a REST API while Google uses a SDK.

- Google credentials 
It's well explain in [their site](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/getting-started) so you should follow their instructions.

- SettingJson
It's a create json and you have to insert your credentials and keys for a Microsoft Azure configuration.
As you can see, inside key *azure_vision-config* there are some attributes that set your expetions about Azure service. 
Keep the attention on these keys:
    - **returnFaceAttributes**
        set options for your request configuration 
    - **containerName**
        set name of the container which you want to analyze. You can analyze obly one container at time.
    - **account and accountKey**
        set your credentials on [Azure storage](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/storage/)
```json
{
    "azure_storage": {
        "account": "{ADD_YOUR_ACCOUNT_NAME}",
        "accountKey": "{ADD_YOUR_ACCOUNT_KEY}",
        "containerName": "{ADD_YOUR_CONTAINER_NAME}"
    },
    "azure_vision": {
        "subscriptionKey": "{ADD_YOUR_SUBSCRIPTION_KEY}",
        "endpoint": "{ADD_YOUR_ENDOINT}",
        "config": {
            "returnFaceId": true,
            "returnFaceLandmarks": false,
            "detectionModel": "detection_01",
            "recognitionModel": "recognition_01",
            "returnRecognitionModel": true,
            "returnFaceAttributes": "age,gender,headPose,smile,facialHair,glasses,emotion,hair,makeup,occlusion,accessories,blur,exposure,noise"
        }
    }
}
```

## Run and test
I develop on VSCode so I leave *launch.json* to run an example of this project and you can also tests this application.

##  Make executable
For a creating purpose run script *build.sh* to create your executable program. I use [pkg](https://github.com/zeit/pkg) so for more information, follow their instructions.
